results.title: Wild green things in the city
results.brief_description: Non-narrated child’s eye-view of plants which can be found growing in an urban environment. Useful for ideas on collection and classification of plants. Suiable for upper primary level.

results.title: Wild flowers of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Shows some of the better known wildflowers of Western Australia. The first section deals with the sand plain flowers between Moora and Carnarvon; the second section covers the flowers of the South West forests.
results.description: Shows some of the better known wildflowers of Western Australia. The first section deals with the sand plain flowers between Moora and Carnarvon; the second section covers the flowers of the South West forests.

results.title: Wild flowers of spring
results.brief_description: This film was produced in collaboration with the Botanical Gardens, Sydney and the Australian Museum, Sydney. Includes brief views of the Waratah, flannel flower, five corners, native heath, bottle brush, red and pink spider flowers, wax flower, Boronia rose, wedding bush.

results.title: Wild Dog Dingo
results.creator_credit: Sky Visuals, One World Films and Gary Steer
results.brief_description: The dingo - a mysterious and controversial animal. Filmed over three years, this program shows the natural behaviour of dingoes as never seen before. It follows the life cycle from mating, birth and the growth of pups to adults. The dingo emerges as a tough, resourceful survivor that has earned itself an important part in the Australian legend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sky Visuals, One World Films and Gary Steer

results.title: Wild crocodile hunt [B&W]
results.creator_credit: PJP Productions, Phillip J Phillips and Lynn Laurence
results.brief_description: A film about a crocodile hunt beginning at Coen, last town on Cape York Peninsula, North Queensland, and ending at Annie River. Shows skinning of crocodile with the carcass being left behind for the carrier to collect. Includes scenes of crocodiles being shot, with some only being wounded and able to escape the hunters. Narration by John Scott Griffiths. Photography by Rene Henri.

results.title: Wild bush budgie; a very particular parrot.
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Sky Visuals, National Geographic Society, Gary Steer and Richard Campbell
results.brief_description: Wild Bush Budgie: The Budgerigar is one of the most popular caged birds. In its native Outback environment, the humble “Budgie” is a master of survival. Introduces this common but very appealing bird. “A very particular parrot” profiles the rare Golden Shouldered Parrot. Only 150 pairs survive in the wild and private collectors are attempting to breed the species in order to safegaurd their survival.
results.title_for_label: Wild bush budgie; a very particular parrot.

results.title: Wild Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Many of the most interesting Australian animals are never seen in their natural habitat even by Australians. Perhaps its because many of them are nocturnal or, even more likely, because the animals are shy or live in such remote places that seeing them is usually by accident. “Wild Australia” reveals many little-known facts about ‘well-known` Australian animals, like the koala, platypus, echidna, Tasmania tiger, numbat, kangaroo and crocodile, filmed in their natural habitat.
